paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the Glu54Gln mutation in the TTR gene associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (ATTRh) in Romanian patients, detailing penetrance data and clinical characteristics.

patients.demographics: 10 females, 8 males; age range: 16-53 years; Romanian ethnic group
patients.phenotype: Hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (ATTRh) with neurological and cardiac involvement

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient 1 [A] age at diagnosis 48, symptoms at onset: Paresthesia, heart failure, dysphagia, diarrhea.
Patient 2 [B] age at diagnosis 43, symptoms at onset: Cardiac symptoms, heart failure.
Patient 3 [C1*] age at diagnosis 35, symptoms at onset: Weight loss, heart failure, paresthesia.
Patient 4 (C2*) age at diagnosis 49, symptoms at onset: Paresthesia, weight loss, heart failure.
Patient 5 [D] age at diagnosis 51, symptoms at onset: Diarrhea, weight loss.
Patient 6 [E1*] age at diagnosis 52, symptoms at onset: Paresthesia, weight loss.
Patient 7 [E2*] age at diagnosis 47, symptoms at onset: Paresthesia, weight loss.
Patient 8 [E3**] age at diagnosis 47, symptoms at onset: Paresthesia.
Patient 9 [F] age at diagnosis 49, symptoms at onset: Paresthesia, heart failure.
Patient 10 [G] age at diagnosis 49, symptoms at onset: Paresthesia, heart failure.
Patient 11 [H] age at diagnosis 42, symptoms at onset: Weight loss, gastroparesis.
Patient 12 [I1*] age at diagnosis 41, symptoms at onset: Paresthesia, weight loss.
Patient 13 [I2*] age at diagnosis 46, symptoms at onset: Paresthesia, weight loss.

functional_data.summary: The Glu54Gln mutation in TTR is associated with destabilization and aggregation of TTR protein, leading to amyloid fibril formation.

variants.segregation_data: The Glu54Gln variant segregates with disease in families, as indicated by family history of neurological involvement or death at a young age.
variants.additional_notes: This is the first report of the Glu54Gln mutation in the Romanian population.
key_quotes: This is the largest Glu54Gln-mutated ATTRh cohort diagnosed to date, and to our knowledge the first describing this variant worldwide.
All symptomatic patients had a family history of neurological involvement or death at a young age.

tables_processed.table_caption: Characteristics of symptomatic ATTR patients with the Glu54Gln mutation

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR gene variant were extracted successfully.
